availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
County Court Clerks Office
Fulton County Kentucky May 16th 1863
At a county Court held this day, among other proceedings had, It was.

Ordered by the Court that W F Buckner be and he is hereby Reccommended to the Governor of the State of -- Kentucky as a suitable person to fill the office of Justice of the peace in District No 3. in Fulton County Ky, the office being vacated by M L McJilton, lately elected, having refused to accept said office.

A true copy from the Minutes of the court.
attest.
Jno T Trent Clerk
Fulton County Court

Fulton Co
Resignation of Justice of Fulton County &c
J. P.
(Fill vacancy as recommended,)
Issd Aug 18. 1863
